job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.industry: Computer Software,Human Resources,Information Technology and Services
job.description: At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work. Once a Workday application is built by our developers it is handed over to the Environments team. This is the team that supports the operations of our applications and services. We manage all environments from production, sandbox, sales, and implementation. This team pushes new code to our existing customers, monitors the health, performance, and reliability of the Workday stack, and in general, "keep the lights on" with 24/7 coverage In this role, we must think about our customers (both internal and external), delivering quickly on a wide range of daily tasks - from environment provisioning, performance monitoring, environment troubleshooting, ad-hoc walk ups and automation efforts; while creating transparency of work being performed.  This position requires a proven understanding of Linux systems in a Production Environment as you will be part of a team that is directly responsible for writing and maintaining scripts (bash, ruby, python) that support the environment provision process.  You understand that Workday Service is available 24/7/365 and requires on-call participation, careful maintenance planning of changes, detailed runbooks -teamwork, maintain due diligence around the 100's configuration tasks that we perform daily. If the work performed is manually repeated often, you find a way to automate the task, in short, you deliver! Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.
